Szczupak.description: A predatory freshwater fish found in lakes and rivers.

Okoń.description: A common freshwater fish with distinctive stripes.

Karp.description: A large freshwater fish commonly found in slow-flowing waters.

Pstrąg.description: A popular sport fish known for its agility and taste.

Sum.description: A bottom-dwelling fish with distinctive whiskers.

Sandacz.description: A close relative of the perch, known for its sharp teeth.

Leszcz.description: A peaceful feeder fish found in lakes and rivers.

Węgorz.description: An elongated fish with a snake-like shape, active at night.

Lin.description: A fish with a greenish color and thick slime on its skin.

Jaź.description: A strong and cautious fish often found in rivers.

Kleń.description: A resilient river fish often hunting insects.

Boleń.description: A predatory river fish known for its rapid attacks on prey.

Płoć.description: One of the most commonly found freshwater fish.

Świnka.description: A river fish that prefers fast currents.

Certa.description: A migratory fish often moving between rivers and lakes.

Troć wędrowna.description: A migratory variety of trout, known for long migrations.

Lipień.description: A fish of mountain rivers with a large dorsal fin.

Jesiotr.description: A long-lived fish with a characteristic extended snout.

Brzana.description: A river fish commonly found in fast-flowing waters.

Krąp.description: A small carp fish often found in lakes and rivers, closely related to the bream.

Głowacica.description: A rare salmonid fish found in rivers.

Miętus.description: A small fish with a unique breeding method.

Karaś.description: A resilient fish capable of surviving in difficult conditions.

Amur.description: A large herbivorous fish, often used to control aquatic vegetation.

Wzdręga.description: A beautifully colored freshwater fish, often mistaken for a roach.

Jazgarz.description: A small predatory fish with a spiny dorsal fin, found in freshwater and brackish waters.
